headline: Japanese rugby relies on France to move forward
subhead: Partnerships linking Japanese professional clubs with Stade Toulousain, the reigning three-time French champions, and Lyon Olympique Universitaire aim to raise the level of the national team, the Brave Blossoms.

headline: 'The Deal' explores the 'reactor core' of international diplomacy
subhead: Set during the final phase of negotiations over Iran's nuclear program in 2015, Swiss filmmaker Jean-Stéphane Bron's series masterfully uses fiction to render the world more intelligible.

headline: Taxing the super-rich? The 'Zucman tax' explained
subhead: A proposal to tax the super-rich by a French economist called Gabriel Zucman has taken center stage in debates about France's budget as Prime Minister Sébastien Lecornu tries to stifle another governmental crisis.

headline: Philippe Aghion, 2025 Nobel in economics laureate: 'The key factor of economic power is technological leadership'
subhead: The French economist was part of a trio that won the 2025 Economics Nobel Prize. In an interview, he argued that France and Europe must invest in innovation to maintain their status as economic powers.

headline: Canada's hottest village lives on despite the constant fear of wildfires
subhead: 'Our planet at +1.5°C' (2/6) Lytton, British Columbia, was consumed by flames in 2021. As the fires have grown ever more destructive, some residents have returned, determined to stay.
